top.title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
top.snippet: At the CES conference, Jensen Huang, the company’s chief executive, said the more efficient and powerful chip would begin shipping later this year.

Nvidia's CEO announced at CES a new, more efficient and powerful AI chip that will ship later this year, along with an autonomous car project with Mercedes.

top.title: Bosch to invest more than $2.9 billion in AI
top.snippet:
Robert Bosch GmbH plans to invest more than $2.9 billion in artificial intelligence (AI) through 2027, according to company statements and media reports published Jan. 6. It’s betting that the technology will help increase productivity and support new products. The investment reflects its effort to expand its use of software and data-driven technologies across its […]
The post Bosch to invest more than $2.9 billion in AI appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.
top.rerankWhy: Bosch's significant investment signals AI's strategic importance
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Bosch GmbH is set to invest over $2.9 billion in AI by 2027 to boost productivity and develop new products, focusing on software and data-driven technologies.

top.title: 2026 will prove whether AI checkout is here to stay
top.snippet: 2025 showed that more shoppers were eager and willing to start their shopping journeys on AI engines like ChatGPT and Perplexity. Now, 2026 will be the year that proves whether shoppers have gotten comfortable enough with the technology to click "buy" within these AI platforms.
top.rerankWhy: AI checkout's future is crucial for retail strategy
top.aiSummary: AI checkout's future will be determined in 2026 as shoppers increasingly start their shopping journeys on AI engines like ChatGPT and Perplexity, with the question being whether they will be comfortable enough to make purchases directly within these platforms.

top.title: Why the AI shopping agent wars will heat up in 2026
top.snippet: As retailers and tech giants race to build AI shopping agents, 2026 is shaping up as a pivotal year to see whether consumers embrace these tools — or whether hype outpaces real-world adoption.
top.rerankWhy: AI shopping agents represent a competitive retail landscape
top.aiSummary: AI shopping agent wars are expected to intensify in 2026 as retailers and tech giants compete to see if consumers will adopt these tools. The year will be crucial in determining if the hype surrounding AI shopping agents matches actual consumer adoption.

top.title: Five Trends in AI and Data Science for 2026
top.snippet: Carolyn Geason-Beissel/MIT SMR | Getty Images Organizations tend to change much more slowly than AI technology does these days. This means that forecasting enterprise adoption of AI is a bit easier than predicting technology change in this, our third year of making AI predictions. Neither of us is a computer or cognitive scientist, so we […]
top.rerankWhy: Trends in AI and data science shape strategic decisions
top.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
The article discusses the challenge of organizations adapting to rapidly evolving AI technology, making it easier to forecast enterprise adoption of AI compared to predicting technology changes.

top.title: CVS Health details AI-driven digital strategy
top.snippet:
CVS Health has outlined a broad digital and artificial intelligence (AI) strategy aimed at simplifying health care delivery. The strategy deepens consumer engagement and supports multiyear earnings growth. It positions technology as a core driver of the company’s next phase rather than a back-office function. At its 2025 investor day in December, the health care […]
The post CVS Health details AI-driven digital strategy appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.
top.rerankWhy: CVS's AI strategy highlights healthcare's digital transformation
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: CVS Health has revealed an AI-driven digital strategy to simplify healthcare delivery, deepen consumer engagement, and support earnings growth. Technology is positioned as a core driver of the company's future rather than a back-office function.

top.title: AI reshapes B2B buying, but RFPs still decide who wins
top.snippet:
Generative artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly changing how business-to-business buyers discover and evaluate vendors, but the final decision still comes down to traditional fundamentals. Those fundamentals include the quality of a vendor’s request for proposal (RFP) response and its industry expertise, according to new research released by strategic response management software provider Responsive. It based […]
The post AI reshapes B2B buying, but RFPs still decide who wins appeared first o...
top.rerankWhy: B2B AI changes vendor evaluation processes significantly
top.aiSummary: AI is transforming B2B buying processes, but the final decision still relies on traditional factors like the quality of a vendor's RFP response and industry expertise. This insight comes from research by Responsive, a strategic response management software provider.

top.title: Brands are upset that ‘Buy For Me’ is featuring their products on Amazon without permission
top.snippet: Online merchants say Amazon’s “Buy for Me” AI tool listed their products without permission, forcing them to opt out after the fact and raising concerns about brand control, customer trust and the impact of AI on shopping.
top.rerankWhy: Concerns over brand control on Amazon are critical
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Brands are expressing frustration as Amazon's "Buy for Me" AI tool features their products without permission, leading to concerns about brand control, customer trust, and the influence of AI on shopping experiences.

top.title: Why 2025 was Shopify’s best year yet
top.snippet: Shopify just wrapped up its strongest year since 2021, with record sales growth, major enterprise brand wins and an OpenAI partnership positioning the company as core infrastructure for AI-driven shopping.
top.rerankWhy: Shopify's growth highlights trends in ecommerce
top.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
In 2025, Shopify experienced its best year yet, marked by record sales growth, significant enterprise brand acquisitions, and a partnership with OpenAI, solidifying its position as a key player in AI-driven shopping infrastructure.

top.title: What shaped retail’s holiday season in 2025
top.snippet: It was a year of AI-generated gift recommendations, tariff upheaval and increased financial stress on shoppers.
top.rerankWhy: Insights into holiday shopping trends are valuable
top.aiSummary: AI-generated gift recommendations, tariff upheaval, and financial stress on shoppers were key factors shaping the retail industry during the 2025 holiday season, as reported by Retail Dive in 2026.

top.title: Retail’s data moment: Why trusted customer data is the new competitive edge

top.title: Retailers like Kroger, CVS plan many more screens for in-store ads in 2026
top.snippet: In 2026, retailers like Kroger and CVS are planning to install more screens in more stores to display advertising and other content -- an evolution of what has historically been limited to small experiments.
top.rerankWhy: In-store advertising evolution reflects retail tech trends
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Retailers such as Kroger and CVS are set to increase the number of in-store screens for advertising and content display in 2026, moving beyond small-scale trials.

top.title: Could Nike sell Converse?
top.snippet: Revenue declines and a 44% drop in demand creation may indicate it’s time to divest the brand, according to BNP Paribas.
top.rerankWhy: Nike's potential divestment impacts retail strategy
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
BNP Paribas suggests that Nike may consider selling Converse due to revenue declines and a significant drop in demand creation, raising questions about the brand's future.

top.title: Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge receives MBE
top.snippet:
British jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge has been awarded a Mem­ber of the Order of the Brit­ish Empire (MBE) for her ser­vices to design. top.title: Tiffany rides into 2026 Chinese New Year with campaign
top.snippet:
Tiffany & Co has unveiled its 2026 Chinese New Year campaign, uniting a Pegasus motif with the House’s most celebrated designs to mark the arrival of a new year. The campaign features a Pegasus motif inspired by a brooch created under the artistic direction of Nathalie Verdeille, chief artistic officer, and rooted in the imaginative world of Jean Schlumberger. The campaign […]

top.title: Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026
top.snippet:
As we enter into 2026, inflation rates are increasing as prices continued to edge up at the end of last year. According to the British Retail Consortium, shop price inflation picked up to 0.7% year on year in December, against growth of 0.6% in November. This is in line with the 3-month average of 0.7%. […]
The post Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026 appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Inflation impacts on jewellery pricing and retail
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Inflation rates are on the rise in 2026, with shop price inflation reaching 0.7% year on year in December according to the British Retail Consortium. This trend is expected to continue in the jewellery industry.
